alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 2:01PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN LAKE COUNTY THROUGH 230 PM CDT... At 201 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, or 20 miles northeast of Ely, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Lake County, including the following locations... Ensign Lake, Hudson Lake, Kekekabic Lake, Disappointment Lake, Thomas Lake, Alice Lake, Knife Lake, Ojibway Lake and Lake Two. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Anyone at a campground should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
